news.title: MetaMask Security Monthly: July 2024
news.subtitle: The MetaMask Security Team has been spreading the word about LavaMoat and LavaDome, has a proposal in incubation, warns about risks to those working in crypto, and our bug bounty program is thriving!

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Argentine biochemist C√©sar Milstein won a Nobel Prize in 1984 for his antibody research.

üéôÔ∏è MetaMask in the Security Ecosystem üîé


MetaMask‚Äôs HackerOne Bug Bounty Program Takes the Cake!

MetaMask's bug bounty program (BBP) got a shout-out from both HackerOne founders for setting a great example to others. This was due to our quick adoption of new policy improvements like Open Scope, which rewards reports for all our assets based on impact, and Fast Payment, ensuring we pay out within a month of receiving a vulnerability report. Our program has been going from strength to strength, with some impressive stats over the last 90 days: 120 reports received, an average time from submission to bounty of 3 days and 15 hours, and a total of $266,000 paid out to date. This showcases the incredible success we‚Äôve been having, and we would like to thank our community of talented hackers such as pkkr, imnarendrabhati, p1security, Nicocha30, T41nk**, Ren√© Kroka, renniepak, hackerOnTwoWheels, and redyetihacks. MetaMask BBP is the best BBP!

Want to help make MetaMask more secure? Report any vulnerabilities you find to us at https://hackerone.com/metamask.

Today @Hacker0x01 is launching a big improvement to program policy pages, providing structure and remove ambiguity! Here‚Äôs a great example from @MetaMask: https://t.co/HlGJrfMEhx.

— Jobert Abma (@jobertabma) July 15, 2024

That was fast. Within hours of publicly releasing the new Program Declarations, @MetaMask has already adopted the Open Scope and Fast Payment declarations. Great programs move with a high sense of urgency! https://t.co/yAltRp1smQ pic.twitter.com/ERfs67AKE6

— Michiel Prins (@michielprins) July 15, 2024

Zbyszek Tenerowicz Talks Defensive Coding at x33fcon

MetaMask Security Lab‚Äôs Zb is at it again! In June, he attended x33fcon: a ‚Äúgathering for IT security professionals and enthusiasts‚Äù where ‚Äúred meets blue.‚Äù He gave a lightning talk and hosted a workshop on defensive coding. This is just the latest in his quest to evangelize the importance of supply chain security - which is the core focus of LavaMoat. Videos for his talk and an interview are up now.

¬†

¬†

Gal Weizman at Microsoft‚Äôs BlueHatIL and OWASP Lisbon Global AppSec Conferences

Gal, also from MetaMask Security Lab, has been making the rounds to discuss DOM isolation and present the work his team is doing around the LavaDome project. He has also been examining how the difference between security for centralized architecture and decentralized architecture forces the industry to push the boundaries of web application security. And, of course, LavaMoat.

In addition to these talks, Gal is happy to report that an Realms Initialization Control proposal that MetaMask presented has been approved to be incubated by the Web Incubator CG community. Implementing this should eventually translate into a native browser-level solution for the same origin concern which was attempted to be solved by the SNOW project originally - an important initiative which will help secure a complex security concern that holds MetaMask back - as well as the rest of the world - when it comes to client side web security.

¬†

¬†

¬†

Understanding Lazarus: The Real Threat to the Crypto Industry

Taylor Monahan breaks down how members of the DPRK advanced persistent threat (APT) group TraderTraitor uses spearphishing tactics to target employees of crypto companies and steal millions. If you work in the industry at any level, in any position, consider yourself at risk.

‚ÄúInstead of thinking you're invincible: Eliminate single points of failure Use hardware wallets / hardware MFA Don't run/build code from strangers Use diff devices for talking vs accessing crypto Don't judge Learn from other's mistakes Educate those around you STAY SKEPTICAL!‚Äù

Meanwhile‚Ä¶


Schadenfreude for Attack on Pink Drainer

The infamous Pink Drainer group recently fell victim to an "address poisoning" scam, losing around $30,000 worth of Ether. In this scam, the victim is tricked into sending funds to a fake address that closely resembles a legitimate one. MistTrack, a cryptocurrency compliance firm, reported the incident, noting the irony of scammers being targeted by other scammers. Pink Drainer had only just announced its retirement in May, having previously stolen millions from crypto wallets. It's tough to feel bad for them.‚Äã

Ethereum.org Mailing List Breach and Draining Attack

On July 2 Ethereum reported that their mailing list was compromised, exposing over 35,000 users to a phishing attack. The attacker sent an email posing as a collaboration with Lido DAO, directing recipients to a website that promised high returns on staked Ethereum, but in reality was a drainer site. The Ethereum security team quickly blocked the attack, alerted the community, and submitted the malicious link to blocklists. No losses were reported, and Ethereum is now migrating some email services to enhance security.

‚ö†Ô∏è Tales of Caution ‚ö†Ô∏è


Threat Actor Exploits Vulnerability in Squarespace to Conduct Account Takeovers

Summary

Researchers discovered that weak security defaults in Squarespace's domain registration process allowed attackers to hijack domains. The vulnerabilities included insufficient verification steps and the ability to change domain settings without proper authentication. These flaws enabled attackers to take control of domains, redirect traffic, and potentially steal sensitive information. The incident highlights the importance of robust security practices in domain management to prevent such hijacks. In Squarespace‚Äôs post-mortem incident, they cited weaknesses related to OAuth as the cause of the incident and claimed to have fixed the issue. They also reported no additional account compromises related to the issue.

How Users Can Protect Themselves

Users should harden their Squarespace accounts by enabling two-factor authentication and removing other contributors. Further, owning domains from registrars that allow hardware tokens for two-factor authentication may provide greater account security. You can also read another full incident report from our friends at Blockaid.

After spending the last four days helping teams recover and secure their Squarespace domains, we believe the vulnerability has finally been patched

A big thank you to @tayvano_, @AndrewMohawk, and numerous others for jumping in and saving the dayhttps://t.co/bP4MW1rXFg

— samczsun (@samczsun) July 15, 2024

Wazir US$240 Million Fund Loss Incident

Summary

WazirX experienced a cyber attack on one of its multisig wallets, resulting in a loss of over US$230 million. The wallet, managed with Liminal's digital asset custody services, required multiple signatories for transaction approvals, including three from WazirX and one from Liminal. The attack exploited a discrepancy between the data shown on Liminal's interface and the actual transaction contents, likely replacing the payload to transfer control to the attacker.

How Users Can Protect Themselves

Following the incident, Wazir halted withdrawals as the scope of the incident was assessed. Users are reminded that custodial solutions that store their crypto can control withdrawals, unlike non-custodial solutions. Wazir is promoting a bounty to help identify, track, and recover the stolen funds worth up to US$23 million.

Rise of Cryptocurrency Job Scams

Summary In June 2024, The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) released a public service warning about cryptocurrency job scams, where fraudsters pose as legitimate employers to lure victims into fake job opportunities. This month, the agency followed up with a more in-depth look into how these scams work and what to look out for. They often involve convincing victims to set up cryptocurrency accounts or transfer funds, ultimately stealing their money. The FBI advises job seekers to be cautious of unsolicited job offers, verify the legitimacy of employers, and avoid sharing personal or financial information with unverified sources. Victims of such scams are encouraged to report the incidents to the FBI's Internet Crime Complaint Center (IC3).

How Users Can Protect Themselves

Users should express increased scrutiny of financial opportunities, such as jobs requiring them to provide initial funds, jobs that cannot be verified independently, or jobs that appear randomly. Users should avoid downloading unknown files and attempt to verify the authenticity of the persona engaging with them before continuing the conversation. Although this public service announcement is focused on scammers exploiting victims through work related to crypto, users should also be aware of attacks during the interview process and insider threats.

nodes.title: How to buy crypto
nodes.subtitle: Peruse the ways MetaMask makes buying crypto speedy, simple, and secure.

image.title: How to buy crypto
image.description: Explore the ways MetaMask makes buying crypto speedy, simple, and secure.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Wondering how to buy crypto, but not sure where to start? You‚Äôve come to the right place. Buying crypto with MetaMask is swift, seamless, and safe. You can use methods like a credit card, debit card, bank account, Apple Pay, Google Pay, or PayPal. No need for centralized exchanges. We‚Äôve cut out all of the unnecessary steps ‚Äî saving you time, and money on excess fees too.

Below, we'll give you an overview of how we make MetaMask wallet powerful, secure, and configurable when you buy cryptocurrencies. Then, you'll find videos and step-by-step guides showing you exactly how to buy crypto with MetaMask on your browser or mobile app.

Let's get into it! ü¶ä

How MetaMask empowers you when buying crypto

  • Buy crypto straight into your MetaMask wallet.
  • Choose the best quote from our industry-leading aggregator.
  • Avoid centralized exchanges, extra steps, and additional costs.
  • Use MetaMask wallet in 188 countries with over 80 currencies available.
  • Select from hundreds of your favorite tokens across 15+ networks including: Ethereum, Linea, Optimism, BNB Chain, Polygon, zkSync, Base, Arbitrum, and Avalanche.
  • Go from cash to crypto back to cash. All in one place.

How MetaMask wallet keeps you secure when buying crypto

  • Get 24/7 help whenever you need it from our expert customer service team.
  • We only work with trusted providers, ensuring that they comply with applicable regulations and are legitimate, responsible parties.
  • Preserving your privacy is paramount: MetaMask does not store ‚Äî nor do we have access to ‚Äî any personal information you provide when buying or selling crypto, such as payment details, personal data, or email addresses.
  • Unlike a centralized exchange, neither MetaMask nor our partners have access to the cryptocurrencies after you purchase or transfer them, meaning you can access your assets immediately without a holding period.

How MetaMask wallet gives you choice buying crypto

  • Choose your preferred way to buy crypto: debit card, credit card, bank transfer, instant ACH, PayPal, Apple Pay, Google Pay, Ideal, SEPA bank transfers, and alternative local payment methods. These are subject to availability based on your region.
  • Select your preferred quote and provider.
  • Using MetaMask Extension on desktop or the MetaMask app on mobile.

If you‚Äôre using MetaMask Extension:

Clicking the Buy & Sell button on the MetaMask extension will redirect you to MetaMask Portfolio. Once there, connect your MetaMask wallet.

  1. Click Move crypto.
  2. Click Buy.
  3. Select your region, and currency ‚Äî located to the right of your wallet address.
  4. Select the payment method you want to use to buy crypto. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal balance. Availability will depend on your region.
  5. Select the crypto token and network that you want to buy on. Example: ETH on Ethereum.
  6. Enter the amount you want to buy. Example: 0.5 ETH Example: $100 of ETH.
  7. Select the best real-time quote from our industry-leading providers.
  8. You'll be securely redirected to the provider's website to complete the purchase, and funds will be deposited into your MetaMask wallet.

Success! ü¶ä

If you‚Äôre using the MetaMask mobile app:

  1. Sign-in to your MetaMask app.
  2. Tap the menu button, which has two arrows in opposite directions and is located on the bottom of your homepage screen.
  3. Tap Buy
  4. Select your region and currency ‚Äî this is located to the right of your wallet address.
  5. Select the crypto token and network that you want to buy on. Example: ETH on Ethereum.
  6. Enter the amount you want to buy. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  7. Select the payment method you want to use to buy crypto. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal balance. Availability will depend on your region.
  8. Tap Get quotes to proceed. Select the best quote from our industry-leading providers.
  9. Complete the transaction on the provider‚Äôs portal, and link your desired payment method.
  10. Review the order summary in your MetaMask app, and confirm the transaction to get crypto in your wallet.

Success! ü¶ä

Ready to get started? If you‚Äôre on desktop, download MetaMask Extension. If you‚Äôre on mobile, download MetaMask app for iOS or Android.

Need more help? We got you. Head to MetaMask Support to speak with our team of experts around-the-clock.

nodes.metaDescription: Explore the ways to buy crypto directly using your debit card, credit card, PayPal, and bank account with MetaMask wallet.

nodes.title: How to sell crypto
nodes.subtitle: Dive into the ways MetaMask makes selling crypto easy, quick, and safe.

image.title: How to sell crypto with MetaMask
image.description: MetaMask makes selling cryptocurrencies fast, easy, and secure. With low fees and seamless off-ramping.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Selling crypto for cash is as simple as can be with MetaMask. You can exchange crypto from MetaMask wallet directly to your debit card, credit card, PayPal, or bank account. No unnecessary steps, no excess fees, no worries.

Below, we'll give you an overview of how we make MetaMask wallet powerful, secure, and configurable when you sell cryptocurrencies. Then, you'll find videos and step-by-step guides showing you how to sell crypto with MetaMask on your browser or mobile app.

Let's get into it! ü¶ä

How MetaMask empowers you when selling crypto

  • Sell directly from your MetaMask wallet, and send cash to the place that works for you.
  • Choose the best quote from our industry-leading aggregator.
  • Avoid centralized exchanges, extra steps, and additional costs.
  • Use MetaMask wallet in 188 countries with over 80 currencies available.
  • Buy crypto, use crypto, and sell crypto. All in one place.

How MetaMask wallet keeps you secure when selling crypto

  • Get 24/7 help whenever you need it from our expert customer service team.
  • We only work with trusted providers, ensuring that they comply with applicable regulations and are legitimate, responsible parties.
  • Preserving your privacy is paramount: MetaMask does not store ‚Äî nor do we have access to ‚Äî any personal information you provide when buying or selling crypto, such as payment details, personal data, or email addresses.
  • Unlike a centralized exchange, neither MetaMask nor our partners have access to the cryptocurrencies after you purchase or transfer them, meaning you can access your assets immediately without a holding period.

How MetaMask wallet gives you choice when selling crypto

  • Choose your preferred destination for your cash including: debit card, credit card, bank transfer, and PayPal.
  • Select your preferred quote and provider.
  • Sell crypto using MetaMask Extension on desktop or the MetaMask app on mobile.

Buy crypto with MetaMask Extension

Click the Buy & Sell button on MetaMask extension to redirect to MetaMask Portfolio. Once there, connect your MetaMask wallet.

  1. Click Move crypto.
  2. Click Sell.
  3. Select your region, and currency ‚Äî located to the right of your wallet address.
  4. Enter the amount of crypto that you want to sell. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  5. Select the account destination you want. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal balance. Availability will depend on your region.
  6. Select the best real-time quote from our industry-leading providers. You'll be securely redirected to the provider‚Äôs website where you may have to share KYC, then directed back to MetaMask Portfolio once you accept the quote.
  7. Upon returning to MetaMask Portfolio click Send ETH.
  8. Click Confirm to complete the transaction in your MetaMask wallet.

Note: You can click on Sell to keep track of your order as it is processed. Times may vary depending on provider.

Success! ü¶ä

Buy crypto with MetaMask app

  1. Sign-in to your MetaMask app.
  2. Tap on the menu button‚Äö which has two arrows in opposite directions and is located on the bottom of your homepage screen.
  3. Tap Sell.
  4. Select your region and currency‚Äîthis is located to the right of your wallet address.
  5. Enter the crypto amount you want to sell. Example: 0.5 ETH.
  6. Tap Send your cash to and select the account destination you want. Example: debit card, credit card, bank account, or PayPal. Availability will depend on your region.
  7. Tap Get quotes to proceed.
  8. Select the best quote from our industry-leading providers. You'll be securely redirected to the provider‚Äôs portal, where you may have to share KYC, then directed back to MetaMask app once you accept the quote.
  9. Review the order summary in your MetaMask app, and tap Confirm to complete the transaction.

Note: You can tap on progress notification to keep track of your order as it is processed. Times may vary depending on provider.

Success! ü¶ä

Ready to get started? If you‚Äôre on desktop, download MetaMask Extension. If you‚Äôre on mobile, download MetaMask app in the Apple Store or Google Store.

Need more help? We got you. Head to MetaMask Support to speak with our team of experts around-the-clock.

nodes.metaDescription: Sell crypto for cash directly to your debit card, credit card, PayPal, or bank account with MetaMask wallet.

nodes.title: Transfers from Coinbase and Binance now available in MetaMask
nodes.subtitle: MetaMask launches new CEX transfer feature to make your wallet more powerful.

image.title: Centralized exchange transfers MetaMask now available
image.description: Centralized exchange transfers from Coinbase and Binance now available on MetaMask.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
MetaMask Portfolio now supports centralized exchange (CEX) transfers from Coinbase and Binance, streamlining the process of transferring assets to your crypto wallet.

Many web3 users have digital assets divided across multiple wallets and accounts, creating a fragmented experience. Moving assets from one platform to another can be overly complicated and involve many steps‚Äîfraught with the risks of copying and pasting addresses incorrectly, and potential security concerns. MetaMask‚Äôs new CEX transfer feature is a solution to this issue, making your wallet more powerful, while also strengthening security.

Instant transfer of assets from centralized exchanges into your MetaMask wallet

MetaMask CEX transfers allow you to immediately move assets between accounts, eliminating the need for manually entering addresses. And, if you have bank accounts linked to your Coinbase or Binance accounts, purchasing crypto directly with your bank account to your MetaMask wallet has never been easier. No additional KYC necessary.

In April 2024, MetaMask partnered with Meld and Mesh to launch a feature that allowed users to track external CEX balances by linking Coinbase or Binance accounts directly from the MetaMask Portfolio dashboard. Now, you can view CEX balances, and also transfer assets from these exchanges into your MetaMask wallet. Neither MetaMask, nor our partners in this integration, will ever have access to your exchange login credentials, or share your wallet addresses with third parties.

CEX transfers will initially support Coinbase or Binance accounts, with expansion to additional exchanges on the horizon. No fees will be charged when transferring digital assets from exchanges to MetaMask. A nominal transaction fee of 0.25% will be applied when transferring from MetaMask to centralized exchanges. Network gas fees also apply.

By bridging the gap between self-custodial and centralized platforms, MetaMask is paving the way for a more powerful, integrated, and user-friendly DeFi ecosystem. Head to MetaMask Portfolio today to get started with CEX transfers.

nodes.metaDescription: MetaMask launches new CEX transfer feature to make your wallet more powerful.
